intro: Anchusa procera, commonly known as tall blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Anchusa procera is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
